summary: Liquorice, or licorice, is a plant native to West Asia, North Africa, and Southern Europe. Its sweet, aromatic root is used to flavor candy, tobacco, drinks, and medicine. It's also sold as a supplement. Overeating liquorice (more than a tiny bit each day) can cause high blood pressure, low potassium, and muscle weakness. Pregnant women should avoid it.
title: Liquorice
